# UIUserNotificationCategory

**Class**

Information about custom actions that your app can perform in response to a local or push notification.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor class UIUserNotificationCategory
```

## Overview

Each instance of `UIUserNotificationCategory` represents a group of actions to display in conjunction with a single notification. The title of each action is uses as the title of a button in the alert displayed to the user. When the user taps a button, the system reports the selected action to your app delegate.

Typically, you create an instance of the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIMutableUserNotificationCategory] class instead of this class. You use the mutable object to add actions and specify a category name before registering them with a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserNotificationSettings] object.

To display a group of actions for a specific notification, configure the local or push notification with the category name of the group. For local notifications, you specify this name when configuring your [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UILocalNotification] object. For push notifications, your server specifies a group of actions by adding a `category` key (whose value is the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UIUserNotificationCategory/identifier] of the group) to the push notification’s payload.

## Creating the action group

- **init()**: Creates an action group.
- **init(coder:)**: Creates an action group from data in an unarchiver.

## Getting the group configuration

- **identifier**: The name of the action group.
- **actions(for:)**: Returns the actions to be displayed for the given notification context.

## Constants

- **UIUserNotificationActionContext**: Constants indicating the amount of space available for displaying actions in a notification.

## Deprecated classes

- **UIActionSheet**: A view that presents a set of alternatives for how to proceed with a task.
- **UIAlertView**: A view that displays an alert message.
- **UIDocumentMenuViewController**: A list of all the available document providers for a given file type and mode, in addition to custom menu items that you add.
- **UILocalNotification**: A notification that an app can schedule for presentation at a specific date and time.
- **UIMenuController**: The menu interface for the Cut, Copy, Paste, Select, Select All, and Delete commands.
- **UIMenuItem**: A custom item in the editing menu managed by the menu controller.
- **UIMutableUserNotificationAction**: A modifiable version of the user notification action class.
- **UIMutableUserNotificationCategory**: Information about custom actions that your app can perform in response to a local or push notification.
- **UIPopoverController**: An object that manages the presentation of content in a popover.
- **UIPreviewAction**: A preview action, or *peek quick action*, that displays below a peek when a user swipes the peek upward.
- **UIPreviewActionGroup**: A group of one or more child quick actions, each an instance of the preview action class.
- **UISearchDisplayController**: An object that manages the display of a search bar, along with a table view that displays search results.
- **UIStoryboardPopoverSegue**: A specific type of segue for presenting content in a popover.
- **UIWebView**: A view that embeds web content in your app.
- **UIUserNotificationAction**: A custom action that your app can perform in response to a remote or local notification.
